options.title: No parts
options.description:
Choose **No parts** if you don't currently have the spare parts
and consumables required for the procedure. You can come back
with the parts later, or order them.

options.title: No tools
options.description:
Choose **No tools** if you don't have the required tools or other
equipment (like lifting equipment) needed to finish the repairs.
You can come back later, or ask for support.

options.title: No time
options.description:
Choose **No time** if working hours are over, or if you have
another appointment you must keep, and you will come back for this later.

options.title: No skills
options.description:
Choose **No skills** if you do not have the required training or
certification to complete this procedure, or if you need the
help of others to complete it.

processes.title: Adjust the steam pressure geldi
steps: sadsad

processes.title: Check the Steam Heating DO on the Diagnostic

steps.00:00.00: Enter the "Main" menu by selecting and pressing the "Menu" button

we110/steam/heater-fail/steam-heating-do.title: Steam Heating DO available

processes.title: Check the Steam Heating DO availability

steps.00:00.00: Enter the "Main" menu by selecting and pressing the "Menu" button
steps.00:07.00: Enter the "Service" menu by selecting and pressing the "Service" button
steps.00:11.00: Enter the "I/O Link" screen by selecting and pressing the "I/O Link" button
steps.00:38.00: Press the "OK" button to enter the edit mode
steps.00:40.00: Change the current DO to one of the available DOs by pressing the up-down direction buttons

we110/steam/heater-fail/steam-heating-do.question: Are there any unused available DOs?

we110/steam/heater-fail/change-steam-hea.title: Change Steam Heating DO

processes.title: Change the DO assignment for the Steam Heating
steps: Press the "OK" button to assign the target DO

Press the "Exit" button to exit. At this stage the software will ask you if you want to save the changes. To save your changes select the "Yes" button by pressing the left-right direction buttons and press the "OK" button to confirm the selection
The software will return to the "Service" menu
Detach the S13 socket plug from the back of the Control Panel
Remove the 7. socket terminal from the S13 socket plug by pushing down the fins of the socket terminal with the terminal removal tool
Attach the S13 socket plug into the S13 socket
Raise up the fins of the socket terminal with the terminal removal tool
Detach the S19 socket plug from the back of the Control Panel

Insert the socket terminal into the 6. socket of the S19 socket plug which corresponds to the DO which has been assigned in the DO assignment step in this video (Step no 1). Warning: You have to select the corresponding socket and socket plug if you choose another DO for this procedure. You can find a list of the DOs and their corresponding sockets on the back of the Control Panel
Attach the S19 socket plug into the S19 socket
Enter the "Diagnostic" screen by selecting and pressing the "Diagnostic" button
Select the "Steam Valve" DO on the "Digital Outputs" frame
Press the "OK" button to activate the "Steam Valve" DO

Check the voltage value by inserting one lead of the multimeter into any socket between the 12. and the 22. sockets on the S11 socket group and inserting the other lead of the multimeter into the 6. socket on the S19 socket group

we110/steam/heater-fail/change-steam-hea.question: Does ±24V DC exist on the DO?

processes.title: Check the cable between the steam control valve and the CP

steps.00:00.00: Unscrew the control valve socket holder screw from the steam control valve coil by using a screwdriver
steps.00:10.00: Detach the steam valve coil socket from the steam control valve coil
steps.00:17.00: Detach the terminal block of the socket from its housing by using the screwdriver as a lever
steps.00:22.00: Check the voltage between the terminals of the terminal block by using a voltmeter

processes.title: Replace/Repair the cable between the Steam Control Valve and the CP
steps: Burada tanımlanan sıra ile arka kapak açma, üst kapaklar (üstte üç ayrı parça kapak var) açma, ön kapak açma yapılır.
Kablo yolu üzerindeki klipsler açılır.
Pano içi makaron çıkartılır.
Kontrol paneli arkasındaki buhar, sıcak su, soğuk su, tahliye, devrilme (yukarı-aşağı) DO kabloları ve ortak uç (eksi) -24V DC kablosu soketlerinden çıkartılırlar.
Yukarıdaki maddede değinilen uçların cihaz arkasındaki karşı uçları da valf soketlerinden çıkartılırlar.
Yeni kablo valf uçları soketlerine takılır.
Kontrol paneli arkasındaki buhar, sıcak su, soğuk su, tahliye, devrilme (yukarı-aşağı) DO kabloları ve ortak uç (eksi) -24V DC kablosu soketlerine takılır.
Pano içi makaron kablolara sarılır.
Kablo yolu üzerindeki kablolar klipslenir.

processes.title: Check the coil of the steam control valve
steps: If the Steam Heating DO has been deactivated by the automatic logout process then re-activate it
Check the resistance value between the terminals of the steam control valve coil terminals by using a multimeter
Attach the terminal block of the socket into its housing
Insert the socket holder screw into its screw hole
Attach the steam valve coil socket onto the steam control valve coil
Screw the coil socket onto the coil via its holder screw by using a screwdriver

processes.title: Replace the coil of the Steam Control Valve

steps.00:00.00: Unbolt the plastic nut which fastens the coil onto the coil armature on the back of the valve
steps.00:11.00: Remove the coil from the steam control valve by pulling it downwards from the front side of the coil along the armature (back of the machine)
steps.00:24.00: Install the new coil onto the steam control valve by pushing it upwards from the front side until the coil reaches the base of the armature (back of the machine)
steps.00:39.00: Bolt the plastic nut which fastens the coil onto the armature whilst pushing the coil upwards
steps.00:52.00: Attach the steam valve coil socket onto the new coil
steps.00:57.00: Screw the coil socket onto the coil via its holder screw by using a screwdriver

we110/steam/heater-fail/check-hose-pneum.title: Check Hose Between Steam Valve and CP

processes.title: Check the reliability of the hose between the Steam Piston Valve and the Steam Control Valve
steps:
Check the reliability of the hose between the Steam Piston Valve and the
Steam Control Valve by detaching the hose from the steam output fitting
of the Steam Control Valve and observing the air flow

we110/steam/heater-fail/check-hose-pneum.question: Is the hose valid?

we110/steam/heater-fail/replace-hose-pne.title: Replace Hose Between Pneumatic Valve and Vane

processes.title: Replace the hose between the pneumatic steam valve and the steam vane with actuator
steps: Check the reliability of the hose between the Steam Piston Valve and the Steam Control Valve by detaching the hose from the steam output fitting of the Steam Control Valve and observing the air flow

we110/steam/heater-fail/replace-hose-pne.question: Is the problem solved?

we60/emergency-stop-alarm/check-alarm.title: Check alarm

processes.title: Check the 'Emergency Stop' alarm status
steps: Check the screen for the alert box

we60/emergency-stop-alarm/check-alarm.question: Has the alarm message been removed?

we60/emergency-stop-alarm/button-pressed.title: Check button pressed state

processes.title: Check the Emergency Stop Button mechanically
steps: Press the ESB to check if the button can be pressed

we60/emergency-stop-alarm/button-pressed.question: Is the button in the pressed state?

processes.title: Release the ESB
steps: Twist the Emergency Stop Button clockwise ⟳ to release it
The button should be pushed up by its springs

we60/emergency-stop-alarm/release-esb-ch.title: Check alarm

processes.title: Check the 'Emergency Stop' alarm status
steps: Check the screen for the alert box

we60/emergency-stop-alarm/release-esb-ch.question: Has the alarm message been removed?

we60/emergency-stop-alarm/replace-esb.title: Replace ESB

steps.0: Check the screen for the alert box
steps.00:01.12: Unscrew the two fixing screws on the left edge

processes.title: Replace the ESB
steps: Unscrew the ESB cable terminals from the ESB contact socket
Remove the contact of the ESB from its back by using a screwdriver
Unbolt the plastic nut from the back of the ESB
Pull the ESB from the front of the CP
Put a new ESB into the empty ESB slot
Bolt the plastic nut onto its bolt at the back of the ESB
Plug the contact of the ESB into its socket
Screw the ESB cable terminals into the ESB contact socket

processes.title: Close the left front panel
steps: Close the panel
Fix the latch
Screw back the two fixing screws on the left edge

processes.title: Check the 'Emergency Stop' alarm status
steps: Check the screen for the alert box

we60/emergency-stop-alarm/replace-esb.question: Has the alarm message been removed?

processes.title: Turn the power off
steps: Twist the power switch 90° anti-clockwise ⤿

steps.00:01.12: Unscrew the two fixing screws on the left edge

processes.title: Check the contacts on the ESB
steps:
Check the conductivity of the contact sockets with short-circuit test
by inserting the multimeter leads into the contact sockets or the contact
screws and testing for both positions of the contact switch. The contact
should be in short-circuit when the switch is in open position (unpressed)
and the contrary in closed position (pressed)

we60/emergency-stop-alarm/replace-esb-co.title: Replace ESB contact

steps.0: Check the screen for the alert box
steps.00:01.12: Unscrew the two fixing screws on the left edge

processes.title: Replace the contact on the ESB
steps: Unscrew the ESB cable terminals from the ESB contact socket
Remove the contact of the ESB from its back by using a screwdriver
Plug the new ESB contact into its socket
Screw the ESB cable terminals into the ESB contact socket

processes.title: Check the 'Emergency Stop' alarm status
steps: Check the screen for the alert box

we60/emergency-stop-alarm/replace-esb-co.question: Has the alarm message been removed?
